comment.author: 41996436@N08
comment._content: Or maybe Mesopotamia? Allied troops, but the gun on the limber looks rather like  a German 10 cm field gun with a Krupps breech... but don't trust me on this one, I'm far from sure, there's bound to be someone around who will tie it down for certain, Carol.

comment.author: 58930216@N04
comment._content: I'd guess Boer War? Could be something to do with Robert Baden Powell, the founder of the Scout Movement....? Looks like that type of uniform, but I am not an expert at all in Militaria!

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: I'd be inclined to agree this smells more Boer War than WW1! The gun could be a Krupps, I thought at first a captured Boer Creusot but the carriage looks unlikely for that.

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: I may have to eat my words! This looks a lot more like a Creusot Long Tom than British field piece! The carriage is similar also which would make it a captured Boer field piece. These guns played havoc with the British troops and proved to be more than a match for British artillery. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/155_mm_Creusot_Long_Tom

comment.author: 40708286@N07
comment._content: It looks like a scene from the end of some sort of action judging by the debris lying around. The horses are also out of harness.

comment.author: 33577523@N08
comment._content: It certainly looks Boer war-ish alright especially the uniforms. There are similar uniforms in this old stereoview I have
